 I. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָא‎</span> **particle of entreaty** or **exhortation** ==I (we) pray, now== (enclitic) (Syriac <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">, <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,">; compare Ethiopic <img class="bdbSeriacGlyph" src="data:image/gif;base64,"> ***veni, age!*** [[BDB#Di|Di]]<sup>§ 160. 1 Lex:675</sup> [[BDB#Kö|Kö]]<sup>ii. 244</sup>); — attached: 

**1.** to the imperative, especially in colloquial style, when it expresses an entreaty or admonition, as [[Gen.12.13|Gen 12:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אִמְרִינָֿא‎</span> say, ***I pray***, [[Gen.13.9|Gen 13:9]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָא מֵעָלַי הִפָּרֶדֿ‎</span>, v[[Gen.13.14|Gen 13:14]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שָׂאנָֿא עֵינֶיךָ‎</span>, [[Gen.15.5|Gen 15:5]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַבֶּטנָֿא השׁמימה‎</span>, [[Gen.24.2|Gen 24:2]] + often, [[Num.20.10|Num 20:10]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎שׁמעונֿא המוֺרים‎</span>, [[Judg.13.4|Judg 13:4]]; [[Judg.16.6|Judg 16:6]]; [[Judg.16.10|Judg 16:10]]; [[Judg.16.28|Judg 16:28]]; [[Judg.18.5|Judg 18:5]], etc., [[Isa.1.18|Isa 1:18]]; [[Isa.5.3|Isa 5:3]]; [[Amos.7.2|Amos 7:2]]; [[Amos.7.5|Amos 7:5]] rarely in a command, [[Gen.22.2|Gen 22:2]]; [[Isa.7.3|Isa 7:3]]). Ironically, in a challenge, [[Isa.47.12|Isa 47:12]]; [[Job.40.10|Job 40:10]]. Once anomalously attached to a substantive, or (accents) prefixed to a verb, [[Num.12.13|Num 12:13]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אֵ֕ל נָא֛ רְָפא נָא֖‎</span> ([[BDB#Ew|Ew]]<sup> § 246 a</sup> [[BDB#Di|Di]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַלנָֿא‎</span>; see **3 b**). 

**2.** to the perfect with ***waw*** consecutive, in a precative sense ([[BDB#Dr|Dr]]<sup>§ 119</sup> <span class="bdbLangGreek">δ</span>) [[Gen.40.14|Gen 40:14]]. 

**3.** to the imperfect, when leave is asked, or a prayer or desire expressed; 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** in 1 person, especially with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ה‎</span> cohortative, [[Gen.19.8|Gen 19:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אוציאהנֿא‎</span> let me, ***I pray***, bring out, v[[Gen.19.20|Gen 19:20]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אִמָּֽלְטָהנָּֿא שָׁ֑מָּה‎</span>, [[Gen.24.12|Gen 24:12]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַקְרֵהנָֿא לְפָנַי‎</span> v[[Gen.24.14|Gen 24:14]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הַטִּינָֿא‎</span> v[[Gen.24.17|Gen 24:17]] v[[Gen.24.23|Gen 24:23]] v[[Gen.24.43|Gen 24:43]] v[[Gen.24.45|Gen 24:45]]; [[Gen.25.30|Gen 25:30]]; [[Gen.32.12|Gen 32:12]]; [[Gen.32.30|Gen 32:30]] + often, [[Exod.3.18|Exod 3:18]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נלכהנֿא‎</span> let us go, ***I pray***, [[Num.20.17|Num 20:17]]; [[Isa.5.5|Isa 5:5]] and in self-deliberation, [[Gen.18.21|Gen 18:21]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ארדהנּֿא‎</span> I will go down, ***now !*** [[Exod.3.3|Exod 3:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אסורהנּֿא ואראה‎</span> I will turn aside, ***now***, and see, [[2Sam.14.15|2Sam 14:15]]; [[Song.3.2|Song 3:2]]; [[Isa.5.1|Isa 5:1]] with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַל‎</span> [[Job.32.21|Job 32:21]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** in 2 person, with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַל‎</span>, in deprecation, [[Gen.18.3|Gen 18:3]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אלנֿא תעבר מעל עבדך‎</span>, [[Gen.19.7|Gen 19:7]]; [[Gen.47.29|Gen 47:29]]; [[Num.10.31|Num 10:31]], etc.; hence elliptical <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אלנֿא‎</span> do not, ***I pray***, (do this,) [[Gen.19.18|Gen 19:18]]; [[Gen.33.10|Gen 33:10]]; [[Num.12.13|Num 12:13]] [[BDB#Ew|Ew]] [[BDB#Di|Di]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **c.** in 3 person, [[Gen.18.4|Gen 18:4]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יֻקַּחנָֿא‎</span> let there be brought, ***I pray***, [[Gen.26.28|Gen 26:28]]; [[Gen.33.14|Gen 33:14]]; [[Gen.44.18|Gen 44:18]]; [[Gen.44.33|Gen 44:33]], etc., [[2Sam.14.11|2Sam 14:11]]; [[2Sam.14.12|2Sam 14:12]]; [[2Sam.14.17|2Sam 14:17]]; [[1Kgs.17.21|1Kgs 17:21]]; [[2Kgs.2.9|2Kgs 2:9]]; [[Ps.7.10|Ps 7:10]]; [[Ps.118.2|Ps 118:2]]; [[Ps.118.3|Ps 118:3]] ironically [[Isa.19.12|Isa 19:12]]; [[Isa.47.13|Isa 47:13]], or defiantly [[Jer.17.15|Jer 17:15]] where is the word of J.? <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎יָבוֺא נָא‎</span>; with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַל‎</span>, [[Gen.13.8|Gen 13:8]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַלנָֿא תְהִי מְרִיבָה‎</span>, [[Gen.18.30|Gen 18:30]] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַלנָֿא יִחַר‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לַאדֹנָי‎</span>, [[Gen.37.27|Gen 37:27]]; [[Num.12.12|Num 12:12]]. 

**4.** joined to conjunctions and interjections: 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **a.** [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אָהּנָֿא‎</span>, contracted] <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אָ֫נָּא‎</span>. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **b.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַלנָֿא‎</span> see above **3 b, c. c.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אִםנָֿא‎</span>, especially in the phrase <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אם נא מצאתי חן‎</span> <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בעיניך‎</span>, used by one craving a favourable hearing [[Gen.30.27|Gen 30:27]]; [[Gen.33.10|Gen 33:10]]; [[Judg.6.17|Judg 6:17]]; [[1Sam.27.5|1Sam 27:5]], and with <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נא‎</span> repeated in the request itself [[Gen.18.3|Gen 18:3]]; [[Gen.47.29|Gen 47:29]]; [[Gen.50.4|Gen 50:4]]; [[Exod.33.13|Exod 33:13]]; [[Exod.34.9|Exod 34:9]] otherwise [[Gen.24.42|Gen 24:42]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **d.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִנֵּהנָֿא‎</span> behold, ***I pray***, craving a favourable consideration of the fact pointed to by <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎הִנֵּה‎</span>, and of the request founded upon it (with which <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נא‎</span> is often repeated), [[Gen.12.11|Gen 12:11]]; [[Gen.16.2|Gen 16:2]]; [[Gen.18.27|Gen 18:27]]; [[Gen.18.31|Gen 18:31]]; [[Gen.19.2|Gen 19:2]]; [[Gen.19.8|Gen 19:8]]; [[Gen.19.19|Gen 19:19]]; [[Gen.19.20|Gen 19:20]]; [[Gen.27.2|Gen 27:2]]; [[Judg.13.3|Judg 13:3]]; [[Judg.19.9|Judg 19:9]]; [[1Sam.9.6|1Sam 9:6]]; [[1Sam.16.15|1Sam 16:15]]; [[2Sam.13.24|2Sam 13:24]]; [[2Kgs.2.16|2Kgs 2:16]]; [[2Kgs.2.19|2Kgs 2:19]]; [[2Kgs.4.9|2Kgs 4:9]] +, [[Job.13.18|Job 13:18]]; [[Job.33.2|Job 33:2]]; [[Job.40.15|Job 40:15]]; [[Job.40.16|Job 40:16]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **e.** (<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎לנו‎</span>) <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אוֺינָֿא לי‎</span> Woe, ***now***, to me (us) ! [[Jer.4.31|Jer 4:31]]; [[Jer.45.3|Jer 45:3]]; [[Lam.5.16|Lam 5:16]]. **feminine** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎אַיֵּהנָֿא‎</span> where, ***pray ?*** [[Ps.115.2|Ps 115:2]]. 
$\quad$ $\quad$ **g.** <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֶגְדָּהנָּֿא‎</span>, peculiarly, [[Ps.116.14|Ps 116:14]]; [[Ps.116.18|Ps 116:18]] my vows to J. I will perform, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נגדהנֿא לכלעֿמו‎</span> ***O that*** (it may be) before all his people ! 

II. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָא‎</span> **adjective** see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎ניא‎</span>. 

 II. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָא‎</span> **adjective** ==raw==, of flesh [[Exod.12.9|Exod 12:9]] ([[BDB#P|P]]; opposed to <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎בשׁל‎</span>). I. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָא‎</span> [<span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִיב‎</span>], <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִיבָ֑י‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נֵיבָ֑י‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נוב‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִיד‎</span> v . <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נוד‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִירָה‎</span> see II.  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נדד‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נָיוֺת‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נוית‎</span> below I. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נוה‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִיחֹחַ‎</span>, <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִיתוֺתַ‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נוח‎</span>. <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נִין‎</span> see  <span class="bdbLangHebrew">‎נון‎</span>.
